result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamar Terrell Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Set at $290.00 payable to Monique H.  To be paid first and foremost.

Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of probation.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS ON THIS CASE:  To be paid during period of probation.   Failure to pay is docketed as a civil judgment. Bail to apply.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence; and that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

No illegal substances.  No contact with the victim unless approved by the Court except the agent may approve contact for pusposes of divorce proceeding.  Third party contact for the purpose of child visitation.
AODA assessment.  Comply with treatment. Random urine screens.

Count five.
Count one.
14A 025597/reversed 9/15/14 to fix.

Defendant Lamar Terrell Hall in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 27 days time served.  Huber privileges for WORK, BIP AND 11/3/14 DIVORCE COURT DATE  ONLY pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply.  Defendant ordered to report on 7/25/14; failure to report will result in a straight time sentence.
.
AS TO COUNT 5:  The Court sentenced defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT OF 4 YEARS, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
Court IMPOSED BUT STAYED the COUNT 2 Sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 years with the following conditions:
-Defendant to serve 60  in the House of Correction, STAYED, until next court date.
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-No illegal substances.
-Random screens.
-No contact with the victim unless approved by the Court, except the agent may approve contact for purposes of divorce proceedings.
-3rd party contact for the purpose of child visitation.
-Cooperate fully with probation agent.
-Maintain full time employment.
-Restitution set at $290.00 payable to Monique H.; to be paid first and foremost.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lamar Terrell Hall in court with attorney Marcella DePeters.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNTS 2,3 AND 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
*
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 5:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  The 6/09/14 jury trial is vacated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
